text:
This was working in 2.0.44 and stopped working after I upgraded to 2.0.50
I have not made any changes in my enviornment other than the Apache Upgrade and 
the page times out after 5 minutes exactly instead of the 15 minutes I have 
configured.

There are several important reports that take around 10 minutes to complete 
that are now timing out since the upgrade.

I can't figure out any other reason for the reports not working and the five 
minutes makes me think it is Apache
creator: ronald.toub@hcs.state.or.us
ronald.toub@hcs.state.or.us
text:
I put 2.0.44 back on my development server and the ProxyTimeout is working.  
The report came back after 10 minutes instead of timing out after 5 minutes.

Something has changed between 2.0.44 and 2.0.50 that has made the ProxyTimeout 
not be used.

I have it configured within a SSL context.  I have enable-ssl, enable-proxy and 
enable-so configured.

Here is the relevent config directives

ProxyTimeout 900
ProxyPass /opus/ http://appserv.hcs.state.or.us:8888/opus/
ProxyPassReverse /opus/ http://appserv.hcs.state.or.us:8888/opus/

appserv:8888 is an Oracle OC4J server.

Since I am pretty sure I have found the point of failue I lowered the Severity.

creator: ronald.toub@hcs.state.or.us
text:
I found the problem.  My Timeout setting was 300 so it was timing out before 
the proxy did.  I updated my conf files and missed that change.
